result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Lynn Hardin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence.  Huber privileges for work and treatment.
Court finds defendant eligible for Dosage Probation Program.

miscConds.notes: Alcohol and drug assessment.  Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.
Pay all costs, fees, and surcharges during period of probation, including any supervision fees.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

Court advised defendant that due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Lynn Hardin

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1
Dosage Probation Approved

Defendant Michael Lynn Hardin in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
BRANCH 02 for BRANCH 03. 
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
As to Count 1 as Amended:  
Defendant ordered to serve 10 months in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence with credit of 5 days time served, and with Huber Privileges for  work and treatment.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 18 months with the following conditions:

*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.  
*Random urine screens.
*Defendant to pay all costs, fees, and surcharges during period of probation, including any supervision fees.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.
*Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
*Court ordered defendant's operating privileges are revoked for a period of 6 months.

Court advised defendant that due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Court finds defendant eligible for Dosage Probation Program. 

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw
No reply from surety/defendant.

AS TO AMENDED INFORMATION:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Case adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 3.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess firearms.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Filed, signed Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
Same bail.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael Lynn Hardin in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Amended Information filed.  On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Possession of THC (Tetrahydrocannainbols) - 2nd or Subsequent Offense, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 961.14(3g)(e), 939.50(3)(i), a Class I Felony.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw
Notice of bail/bond forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($50.00) ad

14RM034957  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
07/15/2014

Defendant Michael Lynn Hardin in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

NO FILE IN COURT.   Case heard for Br. 03.  Defendant appears in court on a violation with a positive test for THC.  Court finds the defendant is not in compliance with monitoring.  Court orders $50 of the bail forfeited.  Bail remains the same.  Defendant to post another $50 cash TOT to Justice Point with the same conditions.

Defendant Michael Lynn Hardin in court with student intern, Jessica Kraft- Klehm, under the student practice rule under the supervision of attorney Anne A Devitt.  Stephan E Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 9/16/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3. aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Michael Lynn Hardin in court.  Attorney Anne A Devitt appears by phone.  Dennis P Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Stephan Nolten.
Defense counsel needs an offer.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 6/17/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Michael Lynn Hardin in court with attorney Anne A Devitt.  Randy Sitzberger for Stephan E Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Court enters a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 5/9/14.

05-01-14

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Michael Lynn Hardin in court with attorney Anne A Devitt.  Defendant Michael Lynn Hardin in custody.  Karyn E Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 12, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
